{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Tensor veli palatini is a broad, thin, ribbon-like muscle in the mouth. It originates from the scaphoid fossa at the base of the medial pterygoid plate and the spine of the sphenoid bone. It then winds around the pterygoid hamulus, and its tendon spreads out to form the palatine aponeurosis, which inserts into the posterior hard palate.", "answer_choice": "A"}
